headline: Ohio political mapmakers ordered to face state’s high court
author: Associated Press
sentences: COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) — The Ohio Supreme Court has summoned members of the Ohio Redistricting Commission to a Tuesday appearance, where they face the possibility of being held in contempt for defying court orders.
The political map-making panel plans a Thursday meeting as they work to break an impasse on state legislative maps that is driving the court summons.
Both the secretary of state and the state attorney general have urged a Republican-controlled state Legislature to move the date.
Mike DeWine, whose son, Justice Pat DeWine, has recused himself.
The stalemate has jeopardized the state’s May 3 primary.
